intro: Entadopsis rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf entadopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its round, leathery leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces a milky sap that contains alkaloids, which can be toxic to animals and humans. Entadopsis rotundifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments within rainforests.
